subject: THOUGHT
verse: Those who lend money without charging interest, and who cannot be bribed to lie about the innocent. Such people will stand firm forever.
reflection: God was against the Jews charging interest or making a profit on loans to the needy (Ex. 22:25; Lev. 25:35-37) but charging interest on loans to foreigners was allowed (Deut. 23:20). Some people are so obsessed with money that they will change their God-given standards and life-style to get it. If money has a controlling force in your life, it must be curbed, or it will harm others and destroy your relationship with God. . .
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to be what You want me to be, and when I fail forgive me for Jesus sake. Let Your daily pardon strengthen my daily perseverance to love You and my neighbor. . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Ps. 15:5

Those who lend money without charging interest, and who cannot be bribed to
lie about the innocent. 

Such people will stand firm forever. 

Today's Thoughts:

God was against the Jews charging interest or making a profit on loans to
the needy

(Ex. 22:25; Lev. 25:35-37) but charging interest on loans to foreigners was
allowed 

(Deut. 23:20).



Some people are so obsessed with money that they will change their God-given


standards and life-style to get it. If money has a controlling force in your
life, it

must be curbed, or it will harm others and destroy your relationship with
God. . .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, help me to be what You want me to be, and when I fail forgive me

for Jesus sake. Let Your daily pardon strengthen my daily perseverance to
love

You and my neighbor. .Amen.



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

"Fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom." Pro. 1:7

subject: THOUGHT
verse: Keep me safe, O God, for I have come to you for refuge. 2 I said to the Lord, "You are my Master! Every good thing I have comes from you. "
reflection: Do you have the confidence of David? Do you have confidence in God's presence and guidance? From birth to death, we are continually in God's grip. BUT what is even better, we have hope in the resurrection. Even though our courage and strength may fail, we know that one day we will be raised to a (New Life) to serve Him forever. He is our security and we must cling to Him. . .
prayer: O Lord, You have called me out of darkness into Your marvelous light. Give me the grace to live as a child of light and an heir of heaven. I pray that all mankind would be drawn to Him who is the light of the world, Your Son, my Lord, Jesus Christ. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 16:1-2 

Keep me safe, O God, for I have come to you for refuge. 
2 I said to the Lord, "You are my Master! Every good thing I have comes from
you." 

Today's Thoughts:

Do you have the confidence of David? Do you have confidence in God's
presence and guidance?

From birth to death, we are continually in God's grip. BUT what is even
better, we have hope in

the resurrection.



Even though our courage and strength may fail, we know that one day we will
be raised to a (New

Life) to serve Him forever. He is our security and we must cling to Him. . .


Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, You have called me out of darkness into Your marvelous light. Give
me the grace

to live as a child of light and an heir of heaven. I pray that all mankind
would be drawn to

Him who is the light of the world, Your Son, my Lord, Jesus Christ. . .Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-_1

subject: THOUGHT
verse: The godly people in the land are my true heroes! I take pleasure in them!
reflection: When David says "The godly are his true heroes" he is actually saying he would choose as models and friends those who were godly and truthful. . . Our friends and associates can have a profound influence on our life. Make sure to keep your eyes on those who are faithful to God and His Word. . .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for my Christian friends. Continue to strengthen my faith and trust in You that I may become a godly hero to some-one today. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalms 16:3 (NLT)

The godly people in the land are my true heroes! I take pleasure in them! 

Today's Thoughts:

When David says "The godly are his true heroes" he is actually saying he
would 

choose as models and friends those who were godly and truthful. . .



Our friends and associates can have a profound influence on our life.Make sure to keep your eyes on those who are faithful to God and His Word. .
.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for my Christian friends. Continue to

strengthen my faith and trust in You that I may become a godly hero to

some-one today. . .Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

God has not called us to see through each otherBut to see each other through.



Carry each other's burdens, and in this way

You will fulfill the Law of Christ. . . Gal. 6:2 NIV

subject: THOUGHT
verse: Troubles multiply for those who chase after other gods. I will not take part in their sacrifices of blood oreven speak the names of their gods. 5 Lord, you alone are my inheritance, my cup of blessing. You guard all that is mine.
reflection: For what do you want to be remembered-or what do you want to pass on to your children and friends? You can leave them no better advise than to hold on to God and the memory of a person who did. . . The verses here can be summarized in this-"Be faithful to the Lord your God. "
prayer: Dear Lord, I humbly confess that I am often troubled by the problems of life. There are times that I don't know which way to turn. So I pray that You would enlighten me by Your Holy Spirit that I may recognize what Your will is in every situation-give me the courage to decide every issue accordingly and to leave the final outcome to Your direction. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 16:4-5 

Troubles multiply for those who chase after other gods. I will not take part
in their sacrifices of blood oreven speak the names of their gods. 
5 Lord, you alone are my inheritance, my cup of blessing. You guard all that
is mine. 

Today's Thoughts:

For what do you want to be remembered-or what do you want to pass on to your

children and friends? You can leave them no better advise than to hold on to
God 

and the memory of a person who did. . .



The verses here can be summarized in this-"Be faithful to the Lord your
God."

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, I humbly confess that I am often troubled by the problems of
life.

There are times that I don't know which way to turn. So I pray that You
would

enlighten me by Your Holy Spirit that I may recognize what Your will is in

every situation-give me the courage to decide every issue accordingly and

to leave the final outcome to Your direction. . .Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"For to me, to live is Christ." Phil. 1:21



Every man must live with the man he makes of himself.

(James M. Lawson)

subject: THOUGHT
verse: The land you have given me is a pleasant land. What a wonderful inheritance! 7 I will bless the Lord who guides me; even at night my heart instructs me. 8 I know the Lord is always with me. I will not be shaken, for He is right beside me.
reflection: It is human nature to make plans and then ask God to bless them-Instead we should seek God's will first. By communicating with God it allows Him to counsel us and give us wisdom. . . Believers and unbelievers alike experience pain, trouble, and failure at times (Mt. 5:45). Unbelievers have a sense of hopelessness and confusion about life over their purpose on earth. Those who seek God however can move ahead, confident in knowing what is right in God's eyes. . . They know that God will keep them from straying off His chosen path. . .
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You, that Your Holy Spirit has guided me to make the right decision concerning You, my God and Savior. I have been richly blessed in the faith that You are my heavenly Father and that Jesus Christ is my Savior. For Jesus sake. . . Amen
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 16:6-8 

The land you have given me is a pleasant land. What a wonderful inheritance!

7 I will bless the Lord who guides me; even at night my heart instructs me.

8 I know the Lord is always with me. I will not be shaken, for He is right
beside me. 

Today's Thoughts:

It is human nature to make plans and then ask God to bless them-Instead we
should

seek God's will first. By communicating with God it allows Him to counsel us
and give

us wisdom. . .



Believers and unbelievers alike experience pain, trouble, and failure at
times (Mt. 5:45).

Unbelievers have a sense of hopelessness and confusion about life over their
purpose

on earth. Those who seek God however can move ahead, confident in knowing
what 

is right in God's eyes. . .



They know that God will keep them from straying off His chosen path. . . 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, I thank You, that Your Holy Spirit has guided me to make the

right decision concerning You, my God and Savior. I have been richly blessed

in the faith that You are my heavenly Father and that Jesus Christ is my
Savior.

For Jesus sake. . . Amen

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Show me unfailing kindness like that of the Lord. . .

(I Samuel 20:14 NIV)



Kindness is a language which the deaf man can hear

and a blind man can see. . .(Mark Twain)

subject: THOUGHT
verse: No wonder my heart is glad, and I rejoice. My body rests in safety.
reflection: David Had found the secret to joy-True joy is far deeper then happiness; we can feel joy in spite of our deepest troubles-Happiness is temporary because it is based on external circumstances, but joy is lasting because it is based on God within us. . . As we consider His daily presence, we will find contentment-As we understand the future He has for us, we will experience joyDon't base your life on circumstances, but on God. . .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Your goodness has opened Your hands to supply all my Needs-and Your love has protected me from harm-But You have also opened Your heart and drawn me closer to Yourself with Your forgiving mercies, Truly, You are wonderful. . . In Jesus name. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalms 16:9 

No wonder my heart is glad, and I rejoice. My body rests in safety. 

Today's Thoughts:

David Had found the secret to joy-True joy is far deeper then happiness;

we can feel joy in spite of our deepest troubles-Happiness is temporary

because it is based on external circumstances, but joy is lasting because

it is based on God within us. . .



As we consider His daily presence, we will find contentment-As we understand

the future He has for us, we will experience joyDon't base your life on circumstances, but on God. . .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, Your goodness has opened Your hands to supply all my

Needs-and Your love has protected me from harm-But You have also opened

Your heart and drawn me closer to Yourself with Your forgiving mercies,

Truly, You are wonderful. . .In Jesus name.Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Let us do good to all people. Gal. 5:10 NIV



All that is necessary for evil to triumph

is for good people to do nothing.

(Edmund Burke)

subject: THOUGHT PS Marcie and I will be gone until Wed.
verse: For you will not leave my soul among the dead or allow your holy one to rot in the grave. 11 You will show me the way of life, granting me the joy of your presence and the pleasures of living with you forever.
reflection: We see here that David is confident that God would not leave him in the grave. Many people fear death because they cannot control or understand it. As believers, we can be assured that God will not forget us when we die. He will bring us to life again to live with Him forever. . .
prayer: Dear Lord, help me appreciate every day, Your many blessings. Let me count them one by one with a grateful heart. May I at no time forget Your benefits when the desire of my heart has not yet been granted. Thank You for the promise of the resurrection. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalms 16:10-11 

For you will not leave my soul among the dead or allow your holy one to rot
in the grave.

11 You will show me the way of life, granting me the joy of your presence
and the pleasures of living with you forever. 

Today's Thoughts:

We see here that David is confident that God would not leave him in the
grave.

Many people fear death because they cannot control or understand it. As
believers, 

we can be assured that God will not forget us when we die. He will bring us
to life 

again to live with Him forever. . .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, help me appreciate every day, Your many blessings. 

Let me count them one by one with a grateful heart. May I at no 

time forget Your benefits when the desire of my heart has not 

yet been granted. Thank You for the promise of the resurrection. . . Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

A righteous man is cautious in friendship-Pro. 12:26 NIV



Character is so largely affected by associations that we cannotafford to be indifferent as to who and what are friends are.

(M. Hulburd)

subject: THOUGHT
verse: O Lord, hear my plea for justice. Listen to my cry for help. Pay attention to my prayer, for it comes from honest lips. f2 Declare me innocent, for you see those who do right. 3 You have tested my thoughts and examined my heart in the night. You have scrutinized me and found nothing wrong. I am determined not to sin in what I say.
reflection: Was David saying he was sinless? Far be it-for a proud assumption of purity. David's claim was an understanding of his relationship with God. In Psalm 32 and 51, David freely acknowledged his own sins. Nevertheless his relationship with God one of close fellowship and constant repentance and forgiveness. His claim to goodness, therefore was based on his continual seeking after God. Let's always examine our own relationship with God does it result from constant repentance resulting in the assurance of forgiveness?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, too often I have forgotten to thank You for every day blessings. I got up this morning and could walk-I opened my eyes and could see-I reached for my food and could enjoy it. O Lord, many are Your blessings. Who could count them all. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 17:1-3

O Lord, hear my plea for justice. Listen to my cry for help. Pay attention
to my prayer, for it comes from honest lips.

f2 Declare me innocent, for you see those who do right. 
3 You have tested my thoughts and examined my heart in the night. You have
scrutinized me and found nothing wrong. 

I am determined not to sin in what I say. 

Today's Thoughts:

Was David saying he was sinless? Far be it-for a proud assumption of purity.

David's claim was an understanding of his relationship with God. In Psalm 32
and

51, David freely acknowledged his own sins. Nevertheless his relationship
with

God one of close fellowship and constant repentance and forgiveness.



His claim to goodness, therefore was based on his continual seeking after
God.

Let's always examine our own relationship with God does it result from
constant 

repentance resulting in the assurance of forgiveness? 



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, too often I have forgotten to thank You for every day
blessings.

I got up this morning and could walk-I opened my eyes and could see-I
reached for 

my food and could enjoy it. O Lord, many are Your blessings. Who could count
them all. . .Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Watch and pray so that you do not 

fall into temptation. Mt. 26:41



There is a silly idea that good people don't know 

what temptation means. . .

(C. S Lewis)

subject: THOUGHT (better late than never)
verse: Arise, O Lord! Stand against them, and bring them to their knees! Rescue me from the wicked with your sword! 14 By the power of your hand, O Lord, destroy those who look to this world for their reward. But satisfy the hunger of your treasured ones. May their children have plenty, leaving an inheritance for their descendants.
reflection: We truly deceive ourselves when we measure our happiness or contentment in life by the amount of wealth we possess. When we put riches at the top of our value system, we let power, pleasure and financial security overshadow the eternal value of our relationship with God. Many often think they will be content when they get riches, only to discover they do not satisfy-and the pleasures fade away. The true measure of happiness or contentment is found in God's love and in doing His will. You will find true happiness if you put your relationship with God above earthly riches. . .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and mercies which are new every day. I thank You that even though this world as so much to offer it can not come pair to the riches I have in You. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 17:13-14 (NLT)

Arise, O Lord! Stand against them, and bring them to their knees! Rescue me
from the wicked with your sword!

14 By the power of your hand, O Lord, destroy those who look to this world
for their reward. But satisfy the hunger 

of your treasured ones. May their children have plenty, leaving an
inheritance for their descendants. 

Today's Thoughts:

We truly deceive ourselves when we measure our happiness or contentment in
life by the amount of wealth

we possess. When we put riches at the top of our value system, we let
power, pleasure and financial security

overshadow the eternal value of our relationship with God. Many often think
they will be content when they 

get riches, only to discover they do not satisfy-and the pleasures fade
away.



The true measure of happiness or contentment is found in God's love and in
doing His will.

You will find true happiness if you put your relationship with God above
earthly riches. . .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and mercies which are new
every day.

I thank You that even though this world as so much to offer it can not come
pair to the 

riches I have in You. . . Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6



It is not the fact that a man has riches which keeps him from the kingdom of
heavenbut the fact that riches have him. . . (J. Caird)

subject: THOUGHT
verse: I love you, Lord; you are my strength. The Lord is my rock, my fortress, and my Savior; my God is my rock, in whom I find protection. He is my shield, the power that saves me, and my place of safety. I called on the Lord, who is worthy of praise, and he saved me from my enemies. (Ps. 18:1-3)
reflection: The protect that God affords His people is limitless-and it can take many forms. David characterized God's care with five military symbols. God is like: (1) A rock that can not be moved by any who would harm us. (2) A fortress or place of safety where the enemy cannot follow. (3) A shield that comes between us and harm. (4) Strength of salvation, a symbol of might and power. (5) A stronghold far above our enemies. . . David praises God for His glorious works and blessings through the years. If you need protection, look to God.
prayer: Seek true peace-not in earth, but in heaven; not in men, nor in any other creature, but in God alone. (Thomas Kemps) May the God of peace Himself give you peace at all times and in every way. (2 Thess. 3:13)
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 18:1-3

I love you, Lord; you are my strength.2 The Lord is my rock, my fortress,
and my Savior; my God is 

my rock, in whom I find protection. He is my shield, the power that saves
me, and my place of safety.

3 I called on the Lord, who is worthy of praise, and he saved me from my
enemies. 

Today's Thoughts:

The protect that God affords His people is limitless-and it can take many
forms.

David characterized God's care with five military symbols. God is like:

(1) A rock that can not be moved by any who would harm us.

(2) A fortress or place of safety where the enemy cannot follow.

(3) A shield that comes between us and harm.

(4) Strength of salvation, a symbol of might and power.

(5) A stronghold far above our enemies. . .



David praises God for His glorious works and blessings through the years.

If you need protection, look to God. 

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Seek true peace-not in earth, but in heaven;

not in men, nor in any other creature, but in

God alone. (Thomas /a Kemps)

May the God of peace Himself give you peace at all

Times and in every way. 2 Thess. 3:13 NIV

subject: THOUGHT
verse: He reached down from heaven and rescued me; he drew me out of deep waters. 17 He rescued me from my powerful enemies, from those who hated me and were too strong for me. 18 They attacked me at a moment when I was in distress, but the Lord supported me. 19 He led me to a place of safety; he rescued me because he delights in me.
reflection: Do your troubles, like "deep waters" threaten to drown you? David, in his weakness and helplessness knew that God alone had rescued him from his enemies when he was defenseless. When you wish that God would rescue you from your troubles, remember that He can either deliver you or be your support as you go through them. Either way His protection is best for you. When you feel like your drowning in your troubles, ask God to help you-hold you steady-and protect you. In His care, you are never helpless.
prayer: Dear Lord, give me the faith to lean wholly on You. Strengthen my trust in Your grace, which is sufficient for my weakness, in Jesus name. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 18:16-19

He reached down from heaven and rescued me; he drew me out of deep waters.

17 He rescued me from my powerful enemies, from those who hated me and were
too strong for me.

18 They attacked me at a moment when I was in distress, but the Lord
supported me.

19 He led me to a place of safety; he rescued me because he delights in me. 

Today's Thoughts:

Do your troubles, like "deep waters" threaten to drown you?

David, in his weakness and helplessness knew that God alone 

had rescued him from his enemies when he was defenseless.



When you wish that God would rescue you from your troubles, 

remember that He can either deliver you or be your support as 

you go through them. Either way His protection is best for you.



When you feel like your drowning in your troubles, ask God to 

help you-hold you steady-and protect you. In His care, you are

never helpless.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, give me the faith to lean wholly on You. Strengthen 

my trust in Your grace, which is sufficient for my weakness, in

Jesus name. . . Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

How shall we escape if we ignore such a great salvation? Heb. 2:3 NIV

subject: THOUGHT SORRY I"LL BE OUT OF TOWN ON BUSSINESS FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS
verse: 28 You light a lamp for me. The Lord, my God, lights up my darkness. 29 In your strength I can crush an army; with my God I can scale any wall. 30 God's way is perfect. All the Lord's promises prove true.
reflection: Some think that belief in God is a crutch for weak people who cannot make it on their own. Yes God is a shield to protect us when we are too weak to face certain trials by ourselves. But He does not want us to remain weak. He strengthens-protects-and guides us in order to send us back into this evil world to fight for Him. And then He continues to work with us, because the strongest person on earth is infinitely weaker than God and needs His help. David was not a coward; he was a mighty warrior who, even with all his warriors knew that only God could protect him.
prayer: Dear Lord, Your knowledge and wisdom is beyond human understanding, You know my every weakness-You know my every need-sustain me so that I will be able to remain faithful during every trial. . . Amen
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 18:28-30

28 You light a lamp for me. The Lord, my God, lights up my darkness.

29 In your strength I can crush an army; with my God I can scale any wall. 
30 God's way is perfect. All the Lord's promises prove true. 

Today's Thoughts:

Some think that belief in God is a crutch for weak people who cannot make it
on their own.

Yes God is a shield to protect us when we are too weak to face certain
trials by ourselves.

But He does not want us to remain weak. He strengthens-protects-and guides
us in order 

to send us back into this evil world to fight for Him. And then He continues
to work with us, 

because the strongest person on earth is infinitely weaker than God and
needs His help.



David was not a coward; he was a mighty warrior who, even with all his
warriors knew that 

only God could protect him.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, Your knowledge and wisdom is beyond human understanding, You know
my 

every weakness-You know my every need-sustain me so that I will be able to
remain 

faithful during every trial. . . Amen



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

For to me, to live is Christ and to die is gain. Phil. 1:21

subject: THOUGHT
verse: 32 God arms me with strength, and he makes my way perfect. 3 He makes me as surefooted as a deer, enabling me to stand on mountain heights. 34 He trains my hands for battle; he strengthens my arm to draw a bronze bow.
reflection: God promises to give us strength to meet challenges-but He does not promise to eliminate them. If He gave us no rough roads to walk-no mountains to climb-and no battles to fightwe would not grow. He does not leave us alone with our challenges, BUT instead, He stands beside us-teaches us-and strengthens us to face them. . .
prayer: Dear Lord, once again Your Word reminds me of Your faithfulness. Because of Your promises I can face the challenges of life with the assurance that You will stand beside me and give me the strength to face each one-thank You Lord. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 32-34

32 God arms me with strength, and he makes my way perfect.

3 He makes me as surefooted as a deer, enabling me to stand on mountain
heights.

34 He trains my hands for battle; he strengthens my arm to draw a bronze
bow. 

Today's Thoughts:

God promises to give us strength to meet challenges-but He does not promise
to eliminate them.

If He gave us no rough roads to walk-no mountains to climb-and no battles to
fightwe would not grow. He does not leave us alone with our challenges, BUT
instead, 

He stands beside us-teaches us-and strengthens us to face them. . .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, once again Your Word reminds me of Your faithfulness. Because of
Your 

promises I can face the challenges of life with the assurance that You will
stand beside 

me and give me the strength to face each one-thank You Lord. . . Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

If you believe, you will receive whatever you ask for in prayer. Mt. 21:22
NIV

subject: THOUGHT
verse: The heavens proclaim the glory of God. The skies display his craftsmanship. 2 Day after day they continue to speak; night after night they make him known.
reflection: It goes without saying that we are surround by God's craftsmanship. The heavens give dramatic evidence of His existence-His power-His love-His care. To say that the universe happened by chance is absured. As you look at God's handiwork in nature and the heavens-thank Him for such magnificent beauty and the truth it reveals about the creator. . .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for all the evidence we have of Your power, love, and existence. I thank You for the beauty of Your creation, in Jesus name. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 19:1-2

The heavens proclaim the glory of God. The skies display his craftsmanship.

2 Day after day they continue to speak; night after night they make him
known.

Today's thoughts:

It goes without saying that we are surround by God's craftsmanship. 

The heavens give dramatic evidence of His existence-His power-His love-His
care.

To say that the universe happened by chance is absured.



As you look at God's handiwork in nature and the heavens-thank Him for such
magnificent 

beauty and the truth it reveals about the creator. . .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for all the evidence we have of Your
power, love, 

and existence. I thank You for the beauty of Your creation, in Jesus name. .
. Amen.

The Spirit Himself intercedes for us with groans that wordscannot express. Ro. 8:26 NIV

subject: THOUGHT SORRY! ! ! I will be gone until next week.
verse: 7 The instructions of the Lord are perfect, reviving the soul. The decrees of the Lord are trustworthy, making wise the simple. 8 The commandments of the Lord are right, bringing joy to the heart. The commands of the Lord are clear, giving insight for living. 9 Reverence for the Lord is pure, lasting forever. The laws of the Lord are true;
reflection: How often have we thought of the law as something that keeps us from having fun? Oh excuse me-I guess that was when we were young and foolish! In these verses we see just the opposite: God's law revives us-makes us wise-brings joy to our heart-gives insight-warns us-and rewards us. God's laws are guidelines and lights our path, rather than chains on our hands and feet. They point at danger to warn us, then points at success to guide us. . .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, bless me each day with Your presence and guide and direct me this coming week. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 19:7-9

7 The instructions of the Lord are perfect, reviving the soul. The decrees
of the Lord are trustworthy, making wise the simple.

8 The commandments of the Lord are right, bringing joy to the heart. The
commands of the Lord are clear, giving insight for living.

9 Reverence for the Lord is pure, lasting forever. The laws of the Lord are
true; 

Today's Thoughts:

How often have we thought of the law as something that keeps us from having
fun?

Oh excuse me-I guess that was when we were young and foolish!



In these verses we see just the opposite: God's law revives us-makes us
wise-brings 

joy to our heart-gives insight-warns us-and rewards us. God's laws are
guidelines and 

lights our path, rather than chains on our hands and feet. They point at
danger to warn us, 

then points at success to guide us. . .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, bless me each day with Your presence and 

guide and direct me this coming week. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Serve the Lord with Gladness" Ps. 100:2

subject: THOUGHT
verse: 12 How can I know all the sins lurking in my heart? Cleanse me from these hidden faults. 13 Keep your servant from deliberate sins! Don't let them control me. Then I will be free of guilt and innocent of great sin.
reflection: May Christians are often plagued with guilt. They worry that they may have committed a sin unknowingly-or have done something good with selfish intentions-or failed to put their whole heart into a task-or have neglected what they should have done- Guilt can play an important part in bringing us to Christ and keeping us behaving properly-but it should not cripple us or make us fearful. . . . God fully and completely forgives us-even for those sins we have done unknowingly. . .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I have sinned, I have been discouraged, I have given way to needless worries, I have questioned Your promises, I have had a doubtful mind. I confess all these and other shortcomings and ask You to receive me and blot out all my transgression against you and my neighbor. Create in me a clean and pure heart and a greater faith. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 19:12, 13

12 How can I know all the sins lurking in my heart? Cleanse me from these
hidden faults.

13 Keep your servant from deliberate sins! Don't let them control me. Then I
will be free

of guilt and innocent of great sin. 

Today's Thoughts:

May Christians are often plagued with guilt. They worry that they may have
committed a sin 

unknowingly-or have done something good with selfish intentions-or failed to
put their whole 

heart into a task-or have neglected what they should have done- Guilt can
play an important 

part in bringing us to Christ and keeping us behaving properly-but it should
not cripple us or 

make us fearful. . . .

God fully and completely forgives us-even for those sins we have done
unknowingly. . .

Today's Prayer suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, I have sinned, I have been discouraged, I have given
way 

to needless worries, I have questioned Your promises, I have had a doubtful
mind.

I confess all these and other shortcomings and ask You to receive me and
blot out 

all my transgression against you and my neighbor. Create in me a clean and
pure 

heart and a greater faith. . . Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

It is written: "Worship the Lord you God and serve Him only."

MT. 4:10 NIV

subject: THOUGHT
verse: 14 May the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be pleasing to you, O Lord, my rock and my redeemer.
reflection: Would you change the way you live IF you knew that every word and thought would be examined by God first? David asks that God approve his words and thoughts as if they were offerings brought to the altar. As you begin each day, determine that God's love will guide what you say and how you think. . .
prayer: Dear Lord, create in me a clear heart so that my words and deeds would be pleasing to You. Continue to be with me and all Your people until journey's end, most gracious Savior and Lord. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Ps. 19:14

14 May the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be pleasing to
you, 

O Lord, my rock and my redeemer. 

Today's Thoughts:

Would you change the way you live IF you knew that every word and thought
would 

be examined by God first? David asks that God approve his words and
thoughts as 

if they were offerings brought to the altar. 



As you begin each day, determine that God's love will guide what you say and
how you think. . .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, create in me a clear heart so that my words and deeds would be
pleasing to You.

Continue to be with me and all Your people until journey's end, most
gracious Savior and Lord. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Who is a God like You, who pardons sin and

forgives the transgressions. . . Micah 7:18 NIV

subject: THOUGHT
verse: 1 In times of trouble, may the Lord answer your cry. May the name of the God of Jacob keep you safe from all harm. 2 May he send you help from his sanctuary and strengthen you from Jerusalem. 3 May he remember all your gifts and look favorably on your burnt offerings.
reflection: God sees and knows the sincerity of our faith. Our prayers and generous giving do not go unnoticed by God. God answers the sincere prayers of those who seek Him by sending the right person or right information at the right time. . .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I give thanks that you are an all knowing wise God. Thank You Lord, that You do hear and know my prayers and answer them according to Your wisdom. You know and understand my ability to handle the things I ask for and give accordingly. . . Amen.
original_content:
Todays Verses: Ps. 20:1-3

1 In times of trouble, may the Lord answer your cry. May the name of the God
of Jacob keep you safe from all harm.

2 May he send you help from his sanctuary and strengthen you from Jerusalem.


3 May he remember all your gifts and look favorably on your burnt offerings.


Todays Thoughts:

God sees and knows the sincerity of our faith. Our prayers and generous
giving do not go unnoticed by God.

God answers the sincere prayers of those who seek Him by sending the right
person or right information at

the right time. . .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, I give thanks that you are an all knowing wise God.

Thank You Lord, that You do hear and know my prayers and answer them

according to Your wisdom. You know and understand my ability to handle

the things I ask for and give accordingly. . . Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Whoever loves God must also love his brother. . . I Jn. 4:21 NIV

subject: THOUGHT
verse: May he grant your heart's desires and make all your plans succeed 5 May we shout for joy when we hear of your victory and raise a victory banner in the name of our God. May the Lord answer all your prayers. (Ps. 20:4-5)
reflection: Although we are not in a position to barter with God, He may still choose to answer a prayer that has a promise. When you pray ask yourself, 'will I follow through on any promises I make to God if He grants my request?' It is dangerous to ignore a promise, especially to God. God keeps His promises, and He expects you to keep yours.
prayer: O Lord, I thank You and praise Your Holy Name! Help me to be faithful in keeping my promises to You. Forgive me for my memory lapses I pray in Jesus name. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 20:4-5 (NLT)

4 May he grant your heart's desires and make all your plans succeed

5 May we shout for joy when we hear of your victory and raise a victory 

banner in the name of our God. May the Lord answer all your prayers. 

Today's Thoughts:

Although we are not in a position to barter with God, He may still choose 

to answer a prayer that has a promise. When you pray ask yourself, 'will 

I follow through on any promises I make to God if He grants my request?'



It is dangerous to ignore a promise, especially to God. 

God keeps His promises, and He expects you to keep yours. . .

Todays suggested Prayer:

O Lord, I thank You and praise Your Holy Name! Help me to be faithful 

in keeping my promises to You. Forgive me for my memory lapses I pray 

in Jesus name. . . Amen. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Yesterday, today forever, Jesus is the same; all may change,

But Jesus never, Glory to His Name. . .
